title: estimateGas is almost 2 times more that actual gas used.
body:
Here is a simple file to replicate

This returns : `gasUsed 2 498 212` when the actual gas used it `1 728 602`

Actual gas used from an example transaction
https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe89883cc1dfb9c595ec7beff00047522f82e1284012d22515256838944097b59

If you run this locally you might get `2021/03/23 23:20:18 execution reverted: Request ID is wrong`
Just need to update the IDs in the file from the last `NewChallenge` event
https://etherscan.io/address/0xf82e9cd64f932f31b842dcf66dc7c23f80d4c27d

```
// Copyright (c) The Arribada initiative.
// Licensed under the MIT License.

package main

import (
	"context"
	"fmt"
	"log"
	"math"
	"math/big"
	"strings"

	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum"
	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/accounts/abi"
	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/common"
	"github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/ethclient"
	"github.com/tellor-io/telliot/pkg/config"
	"github.com/tellor-io/telliot/pkg/contracts/tellor"
)

func main() {
	client, err := ethclient.Dial("...........")
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}

	gasPrice, err := client.SuggestGasPrice(context.Background())
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}
	abiP, err := abi.JSON(strings.NewReader(tellor.TellorABI))
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}
	reqIDs := [5]*big.Int{
		big.NewInt(57),
		big.NewInt(46),
		big.NewInt(47),
		big.NewInt(1),
		big.NewInt(10),
	}
	reqVals := [5]*big.Int{
		big.NewInt(math.MaxInt64),
		big.NewInt(math.MaxInt64),
		big.NewInt(math.MaxInt64),
		big.NewInt(math.MaxInt64),
		big.NewInt(math.MaxInt64),
	}
	packed, err := abiP.Pack("submitMiningSolution", "", reqIDs, reqVals)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}
	x := common.HexToAddress(config.TellorAddress)
	data := ethereum.CallMsg{
		From:     common.HexToAddress("0xDD6D1C35518fc955BBBeb52C5c1f5Fb4E16D7EAF"),
		To:       &x,
		GasPrice: gasPrice,
		Data:     packed,
	}
	gasUsed, err := client.EstimateGas(context.Background(), data)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}
	fmt.Println("gasUsed", gasUsed)

}

```

Modules file<
```

module github.com/tellor-io/telliot

go 1.12

require (
	github.com/alecthomas/kong v0.2.11
	github.com/allegro/bigcache v1.2.1 // indirect
	github.com/aristanetworks/goarista v0.0.0-20190712234253-ed1100a1c015 // indirect
	github.com/benbjohnson/clock v1.1.0
	github.com/btcsuite/btcd v0.21.0-beta // indirect
	github.com/cespare/cp v1.1.1 // indirect
	github.com/davecgh/go-spew v1.1.1
	github.com/deckarep/golang-set v1.7.1 // indirect
	github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum v1.9.26-0.20210104105223-f83fc302a504
	github.com/fjl/memsize v0.0.0-20190710130421-bcb5799ab5e5 // indirect
	github.com/go-kit/kit v0.10.0
	github.com/hashicorp/go-multierror v1.1.0
	github.com/hashicorp/golang-lru v0.5.4
	github.com/joho/godotenv v1.3.0
	github.com/mattn/go-colorable v0.1.4 // indirect
	github.com/mattn/go-isatty v0.0.11 // indirect
	github.com/oklog/run v1.1.0
	github.com/phayes/freeport v0.0.0-20180830031419-95f893ade6f2
	github.com/pkg/errors v0.9.1
	github.com/pmezard/go-difflib v1.0.0
	github.com/prometheus/client_golang v1.9.0
	github.com/prometheus/tsdb v0.10.0 // indirect
	github.com/rjeczalik/notify v0.9.2 // indirect
	github.com/rs/cors v1.7.0 // indirect
	github.com/status-im/keycard-go v0.0.0-20190424133014-d95853db0f48 // indirect
	github.com/syndtr/goleveldb v1.0.1-0.20200815110645-5c35d600f0ca
	github.com/tyler-smith/go-bip39 v1.0.2 // indirect
	github.com/yalp/jsonpath v0.0.0-20180802001716-5cc68e5049a0
	go.uber.org/goleak v1.1.10
	golang.org/x/crypto v0.0.0-20201221181555-eec23a3978ad
	golang.org/x/sys v0.0.0-20201231184435-2d18734c6014 // indirect
)

```

The transaction in question sets some slots to `0`, which adds to the `refund`. The `refund` is given back after the call. So for example, a tx can use `1M` gas, and _need_ that much to execute, but after it's done, `500K` is given back. So `1M` is the high-water-mark, but in the end it only consumes `500K` gas of the block's total gas usage. 

![Screenshot_2021-03-24 Ethereum Transaction Hash (Txhash) Details Etherscan](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/142290/112300703-6e19c680-8c99-11eb-96b7-67bdd571d7c1.png)
